data.quote: We can not solve our problems with the same level of thinking that created them.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
data.author: Duke Ellington

data.quote: A problem well stated is a problem half solved.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: If your only tool is a hammer then every problem looks like a nail.
data.author: Abraham Maslow

data.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: A problem well put is half solved.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: To crack a serious problem, crack a joke.
data.author: Haresh Sippy

data.quote: If you have a problem, it means you are very powerful.
data.author: Meir Ezra

data.quote: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
data.author: Walt Disney

data.quote: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
data.author: Chris Grosser

data.quote: Try not to become a person of success, but rather try to become a person of value.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
data.author: David Brinkley

data.quote: When you stop chasing the wrong things, you give the right things a chance to catch you.
data.author: Lolly Daskal

data.quote: Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
data.author: Lolly Daskal

data.quote: All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
data.author: Michael John Bobak

data.quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
data.author: Mark Caine
